thread.title: O'Hara, Wood girls reach Catholic League final
thread.title_full: O'Hara, Wood girls reach Catholic League final

author: Kate Harman , STAFF WRITER
title: O'Hara, Wood girls reach Catholic League final
text:
One couldn't be quite sure exactly what had Neumann-Goretti on its heels for the majority of Thursday night's Catholic League semifinal against Cardinal O'Hara.
Was it the timely rebounding of Mary Sheehan?
Was it the way Hannah Nihill deftly navigated through the Saints to find her open teammates?
Or perhaps it was the three early threes Maura Hendrixson hit, the shots that gave the Lions momentum in a way the squad could never quite muster during the regular-season matchup.
It was all of those things, along with the way junior Molly Paolino played defense all contest long.
Paolino was tough, gritty, a pest - you pick the adjective and the guard fit the bill - as O'Hara defeated N-G, 57-42, at Philadelphia University.
"Molly is the most underrated person on our team," Sheehan said. "I always say to my parents and coaches, Molly is, in a way, our MVP. She just goes out and does the dirty work - the stuff that's not on paper."
O'Hara advanced to play Archbishop Wood, a 52-37 winner over Archbishop Carroll in the other semifinal. The Lions and Vikings will square off for the title Monday at the Palestra.
On paper, O'Hara (19-5) was consistently great, getting terrific efforts from up and down the roster on both ends of the floor. The result is the first trip to the league title game for the senior class, as well as the first time the squad has beaten the Saints (18-5).
"Pretty indescribable," Sheehan said. "We had the mentality that we were going to do it. We are just really excited to get that second chance, especially after how the regular season went. I'm ecstatic, I'm shaking."
With 54 seconds remaining, coach Linus McGinty subbed out his starters, something Gardler wasn't expecting.
"I had my head turned and everyone starting cheering - but that's when I knew we made it to the Palestra," said the Villanova recruit, who led all players with 19 points.
Sheehan had that same realization.
"Let's do this" the St. Joseph's recruit said to her teammates as they walked off the court together.
"We are going to the Palestra," Sheehan added. "Thirty-two more minutes."
Wood 52, Carroll 37 - Point guard Cassie Sebold scored a team-high 16 points as the Vikings (18-60 punched their ticket to the Catholic League final.
Wood held off a scrappy Patriots team (17-7) that stayed in the contest until late in the fourth quarter. Powered by Sebold, the Vikings got strong efforts from Shannon and Katie May, who took turns igniting the offense.
"For me, I see the scoreboard but it isn't in my head," Sebold said. "It's about running the offense, getting open shots.
Cardinal O'Hara 11 19 13 14 - 57
Neumann-Goretti 8 10 13 11 - 42
CO: Kenzie Gardler 19, Maura Hendrixson 15, Mary Sheehan 10, Hannah Nihill 9, Molly Paolino 4.
NG: Chyna Nixon 12, Jabria Ingram 11, Tatiana Jones 7, Ashley Jones 6, Minika Glenn 6.
Archbishop Carroll 9 11 10 7 - 37
Archbishop Wood 9 14 12 17 - 52
CO: AC: Bella Sorrentino 9, Theresa Kearney 8, Molly Masciantonio 7, Erin Sweeney 6, Maggie Pina 5, Wynter Bess 2
AW: Cassie Sebold 16, Katie May 12, Shannon May 11, Meg Neher 7, Bridget Arcidiacono 6
kharman@phillynews.com
